The Tartarean Acrolyte 



Image Source: https://i.pinimg.com/originals/e7/5b/fc ... 9e9c11.jpg

Background:
In Greek mythology, Tartarus (/ˈtɑːrtərəs/; Ancient Greek: Τάρταρος, Tartaros) is the deep abyss that is used as a dungeon of torment and suffering for the wicked and as the prison for the Titans.

- Source: Wikipedia



Build Notes:
This is a fairly simple build draft, it aims to be:
- dexterity based with uncanny dodge/evasion/epic dodge
- have maximal attacks / round with BAB 26+, Monk UBAB and ITWF Kama
- high sneak attack
- added divine damage from divine might
- added damage from some base strength
- cool RP from being an evil blackguard monk

It obtains:
- Melee Base AB 40, BAB 27, Weapon Finesse, Blind Fight, Knockdown/Improved Knockdown, WF/EWF: Kama, Epic Prowess, Great Dexterity VI, Taunt 43(47) to lower enemy AC by up to 6
- 6-8 APR single Kama, 8-10 APR dual Kama [depending on Flurry/Haste]
- Sneak Attack 15d6, Crippling Strike, Demonic Summons to help with dealing sneaks
- Divine Might, 4-10 divine damage / hit
- Str damage 2-8/hit main hand (depending if Str is capped), able to use stackable bull's strength from Blackguard
- Can add more damage with UMD or buffs from teammates (ie Flame Weapon)

- 344 HP [604 HP capped], Deflect Arrows [only with single kama - a free hand is required], Uncanny Dodge/Evasion/Improved Evasion, Epic Dodge [level 33], +9 AC from Tumble 40 / Monk, Uncanny Dodge VI (to assist protecting against flanking sneak attacks from non-dedicated rogues/assassins)
- Fort 28 (30) Will 22 (26) Reflex 35 (37). Saves against spells in () brackets. Add +5 against traps from Uncanny Dodge VI. With capped Cha/Con/Wis/Dex add 12 to each save. 

- 328 skill points to max skills that you desire. I chose Discipline, Hide, Move Silently, Taunt, Spot, Tumble 40, UMD 33 modified, some points in disable trap, search, crossclassed spellcraft, value points in set trap and open lock.

Weaknesses:
- Arcane casters using Time Stop / Mord's / Bigby's etc
- High AB Dev Crit Weapon Masters, Implosion users, Petrification users
- Sneak Immunes and High Damage Reduction opponents such as golems/undead

Wishlist:
These are things I wish I could have incorporated but wasn't able to fit into the build. 
These are not necessarily weaknesses, simply things that would have been nice.
Items and spell buffs can be obtained to try to find these properties in game.

- More AB [Elf could add 1 AB with 20% multiclass penalties and -40hp/-1 fort, halfling 2 base AB with single Kama, -2 Str]
- More HP [ie Toughness feat, higher Cons score]
- More Charisma
- Epic Fortitude feat
- Epic Skill Focus: Taunt [to lower AC further] and Spot [to enhance scouting capabilities]

Other Rogue/Monk/BG builds:
Blackguard is an under-explored and underrated class, and I have only identified 3 builds with this class combination, none of which take the amounts of classes I do.

Summary:
To me this looks like a speedy, stealthy and difficult to kill melee flanking destroyer, anything vulnerable to its sneak attack is going to die rapidly. 
Good enough solo, devastating in a party.
The class combination appears novel and underexplored.

Sneak immune opponents +/- Damage Reduction opponents can be a challenge for dex sneakers. 
For this I have added divine damage, added strength damage, added damage from UMD, and the ability to set minor holy traps (for undead). 

Mages are the bane of any melee character who is not a high ISR Monk. Items with magic damage resistance, Bigby's scrolls / Wands of Lesser Spell Breach / Mord's Scrolls could be useful to deal with them.

One should approach Devastating Critical users and Implosion users carefully by either disabling these opponents and eliminating them rapidly, by boosting the Fortitude save further in game before approaching them or other approaches.
